name: Path N NET Colon
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 12 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (1) 

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Regional lymph nodes for colon**
 
**All colon sites** 

    Colic [NOS] 
    Epicolic (adjacent to bowel wall) 
    Mesocolic [NOS] 
    Mesenteric [NOS]
    Paracolic/pericolic

**Cecum (C180)** 

    Anterior (prececal), 
    Cecal [NOS]
    Ileocolic
    Periappendiceal
    Posterior (retrocecal)
    Right colic 

**Ascending colon (C182)** 

    Ileocolic
    Middle colic
    Right colic

**Hepatic flexure (C183)** 

    Middle colic 
    Right colic

**Transverse colon (C184)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Middle colic 
    Right colic

**Splenic flexure (C185)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Middle colic

**Descending colon (C186)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Sigmoid 

**Sigmoid colon (C187)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Rectosigmoid 
    Sigmoid 
    Sigmoidal (sigmoid mesenteric) 
    Superior hemorrhoidal 
    Superior rectal
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 104
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
